titleStmt.title: TO THE RIGHT Worshipfull his dearely respected Patron, Syr VVilliam Hide Knight.
titleStmt.author: L., W.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: TO THE RIGHT Worshipfull his dearely respected Patron, Syr VVilliam Hide Knight.
analytic.author: L., W.

monogr.title: Nothing for a nevv-yeares gift : Nihil ext ex onmi parte beatum. By W.L. Sit voluisse sat valuisse
monogr.author: Lisle, William

div.head: TO THE RIGHT Worshipfull his dearely respected Patron, Syr VVilliam Hide Knight.

lg.l: TO you that daine my ditties to peruse,
And gild the temper of my brazen quill,
You that giue strength vnto my weakned Muse,
To clamber vp the height of learned skill.
You that for nothing shewe this generous minde,
You that to bountie haue your soules inclinde,
(VVhich shewes the world your world of worthines)
Nothing I send you for a Newyeares gift,
The faint endeuours of my sickly spirit,
Measure my meaning and my vertuous drift,
My loue, zeale, dutie, and your owne demerit.
You lookt for Nothing, Nothing I impart,
VVith the poore remnant of my broken hart.

closer.signed: Your worthy vertues euer vowed: VV. L.
